pr_title: [2.20.x] DDF-5649 G-6176 Add interface to filter warnings (#5843)

timeline.message:
DDF-5649 G-6176 Add interface to filter warnings (#5843)

In response to a malfunction of a query which the user runs, the user
would like a message which describes or explains the malfunction so that
the user can more easily resolve the malfunction. This commit supports
the user's aforementioned desire in that it:

 - adds an interface—SourceWarningsFilter—which allows that a Source
   which implements it filter the warnings of ProcessingDetails of a
   SourceResponse which the Source may receive from the execution of a
   query and, thereby, produce new ProcessingDetails whose warnings
   contain only each warning of the original ProcessingDetails which
   describes or explains a malfunction which occurred in the execution
   of the query

 - ensures that the implementations of SourceResponse not return null
   from getProcessingDetails(), in accordance with the dictate of the
   Javadoc of SourceResponse.getProcessingDetails()

 - refactors some of the code which relates to the changes listed above
DDF-5649 G-6176 routes details back to client
DDF-5649 G-6176 routes details back to client

timeline.bodyText: Not sure the context, but just making sure we are fine finding only the first and not using the rest? We don't need to collapse/reduce them into a single set?
timeline.author: rzwiefel
